marketplaces.repo_description: Multi-Agent Orchestration System for Autonomous Software Development

files.README.md:
![Claude Code Plugin](https://img.shields.io/badge/Claude_Code-Plugin-7C3AED?style=for-the-badge&logo=anthropic&logoColor=white) ![Version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-1.0.0-blue?style=for-the-badge) ![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-green?style=for-the-badge) # ORC ### Autonomous Software Development Through Multi-Agent Orchestration **One prompt. Nineteen agents. Production-ready code.** ```bash /plugin marketplace add twofoldtech-dakota/ORC ``` [Installation](#-installation) â€¢ [Quick Start](#-quick-start) â€¢ [Commands](#-commands) â€¢ [Architecture](#-architecture) â€¢ [Documentation](#-documentation)
--- ## Overview ORC transforms high-level goals into complete, tested implementations. You describe what you want; ORC handles decomposition, implementation, validation, and learningâ€”autonomously. ``` "Build a user authentication system with email verification" â†“ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ ANALYZE â†’ PLAN â†’ EXECUTE â†’ VALIDATE â†’ REVIEW â†’ LEARN â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â†“ âœ“ 3 Epics, 9 Features, 27 Stories completed âœ“ 94 tests passing âœ“ Patterns extracted for future use ``` --- ## ğŸ“¦ Installation ### Prerequisites [Claude Code CLI](https://docs.anthropic.com/claude-code) installed and authenticated. ```bash # Verify Claude Code is installed claude --version ``` ### Install from Marketplace Start Claude Code and run these commands: ```bash # Add the ORC marketplace /plugin marketplace add twofoldtech-dakota/ORC # Install the plugin /plugin install orc@orc-marketplace ``` Or use interactive discovery: ```bash /plugin discover ``` ### Verify Setup ```bash /orc:status ``` Expected output: ``` ğŸ“Š ORC Status No active session. Run /orc:plan to start. ``` ### Updating & Uninstalling ```bash # Update the marketplace /plugin marketplace update orc-marketplace # Uninstall /plugin uninstall orc@orc-marketplace ``` --- ## ğŸš€ Quick Start ### Basic Usage Navigate to your project and invoke ORC with a goal: ```bash cd your-project # Start Claude Code claude # Plan and execute a feature > /orc:plan "Add user authentication with JWT tokens" ``` ORC will: 1. **Analyze** your codebase (conventions, patterns, dependencies) 2. **Plan** an Epic â†’ Feature â†’ Story hierarchy 3. **Present** the plan for your approval 4. **Execute** each story with specialist agents 5. **Validate** against acceptance criteria 6. **Learn** patterns for future executions ### Example Session ``` You: /orc:plan "Build a REST API with user management" ORC: ğŸ” Analyzing Codebase... âœ“ Project: typescript (express, prisma) Patterns: repository, zod validation ğŸ“‹ Plan Created: Build a REST API with user management Epics (2): E1: User Authentication [3 features, 9 stories] â”œâ”€ F1: User Registration (3 stories) â”œâ”€ F2: User Login (3 stories) â””â”€ F3: Password Reset (3 stories) E2: User Management [2 features, 6 stories] â”œâ”€ F1: Profile Management (3 stories) â””â”€ F2: Account Settings (3 stories) Total: 5 features, 15 stories Codebase alignment: 94% Run /orc:approve to proceed You: /orc:approve ORC: âœ“ Plan approved. Run /orc:run to execute. You: /orc:run ORC: ğŸš€ Starting execution... [E1-F1-S1] Creating User model with password hashing â”œâ”€ REASON: Loading pattern sp_bcrypt_001 â”œâ”€ ACT: Creating src/models/User.ts â”œâ”€ ACT: Creating src/models/User.test.ts â”œâ”€ VERIFY: âœ“ Tests pass (4/4) â””â”€ COMPLETE âœ“ [8.2s] ... (continues autonomously) ... [EXECUTION COMPLETE] â”œâ”€ Stories: 15/15 completed â”œâ”€ Tests: 47 passing â””â”€ Patterns learned: 3 new ``` --- ## ğŸ“‹ Commands | Command | Description | Example | |---------|-------------|---------| | `/orc:analyze` | Profile codebase conventions and patterns | `/orc:analyze --focus security` | | `/orc:plan ` | Create Epic â†’ Feature â†’ Story hierarchy | `/orc:plan "Add payments"` | | `/orc:show` | Display plan summary | `/orc:show E1` | | `/orc:approve` | Approve plan for execution | `/orc:approve E1` | | `/orc:run` | Execute approved epics | `/orc:run E1` | | `/orc:next` | Execute next epic only | `/orc:next` | | `/orc:stop` | Gracefully pause execution | `/orc:stop` | | `/orc:resume` | Continue from checkpoint | `/orc:resume` | | `/orc:retry ` | Retry a blocked story | `/orc:retry E1-F2-S3` | | `/orc:patterns` | Show learned patterns | `/orc:patterns auth` | | `/orc:learn` | Force pattern extraction | `/orc:learn` | | `/orc:status` | Show current state | `/orc:status` | | `/orc:clear` | Reset plan and state | `/orc:clear` | --- ## ğŸ”„ Workflow ``` â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ USER GOAL â”‚ â”‚ "Build a dashboard with analytics" â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ matching from learnings â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â†’ Architect (system design) â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â†’ Product Designer (UX flows) â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â†’ Biz Analyst (requirements) â”‚ â”‚ EXECUTE PHASE â”‚ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ IMPLEMENTER â”‚ â”€â”€â”€â–¶ â”‚ VALIDATOR â”‚ â”€â”€â”€â–¶ â”‚ REVIEWER â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â†’ Backend Specialist (APIs, services) â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â†’ Database Engineer (schema, migrations) â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€â†’ Security Engineer (auth, encryption) â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â†’ DevOps Engineer (CI/CD, Docker) â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ LEARN PHASE â”‚ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ LEARNER â”‚ â†’ Extract patterns, anti-patterns, preferences â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â†’ Update embeddings for future matching â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## ğŸ— Architecture ### Agent Hierarchy ORC deploys **19 specialized agents** organized into two tiers: #### Core Agents (7) | Agent | Role | Pattern | |-------|------|---------| | **Orchestrator** | State management, phase control, delegation | State Machine | | **Analyzer** | Codebase profiling, convention extraction | Pre-flight Analysis | | **Planner** | Goal decomposition, dependency mapping | Tree-of-Thoughts | | **Implementer** | Story execution, code generation | ReAct | | **Validator** | Test execution, criteria verification | Chain-of-Verification | | **Reviewer** | Quality gates, deviation analysis | Reflexion | | **Learner** | Pattern extraction, knowledge persistence | Memory Persistence | #### Specialist Agents (12) | Specialist | Domain | Spawned By | |------------|--------|------------| | **Architect** | System design, patterns, scalability | Planner, Implementer | | **Security** | Auth, encryption, OWASP compliance | Implementer, Reviewer | | **Database** | Schema design, migrations, optimization | Planner, Implementer | | **Frontend** | React/Vue, CSS, accessibility, animations | Implementer | | **Backend** | REST, GraphQL, business logic | Implementer | | **Fullstack** | End-to-end feature implementation | Implementer | | **DevOps** | CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes | Planner, Implementer | | **QA** | Test strategy, edge cases, coverage | Validator, Reviewer | | **Product Designer** | UX flows, acceptance criteria | Planner | | **Biz Analyst** | Requirements, business rules | Planner | | **Content Strategist** | SEO, messaging, copy | Planner, Implementer | | **Design Researcher** | UI reference research, innovation | Implementer | ### Plan Hierarchy ``` Plan â””â”€â”€ Epic (self-contained project milestone) â””â”€â”€ Feature (self-contained capability) â””â”€â”€ Story (atomic task with acceptance criteria) ``` **Constraints enforced:** - No cross-epic dependencies - No cross-feature dependencies within epic - Stories can only depend on stories within same feature ### Quality Gates | Level | Gate | Checks | |-------|------|--------| | **Story** | Validator | Tests pass, types check, lint clean, criteria met | | **Feature** | Validator | All stories complete, integration tests pass | | **Epic** | Reviewer | Security scan, design review, innovation score | ### Checkpoint System ORC saves checkpoints at every boundary: ``` .orc/ â”œâ”€â”€ plan/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ state.json # Current execution state â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ plan.json # Master plan metadata â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ codebase_profile.json # Analysis results â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ learnings.json # Accumulated patterns â”‚ â””â”€â”€ epics/ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ E1.json â”‚ â””â”€â”€ E2.json â””â”€â”€ checkpoints/ â”œâ”€â”€ E1-F1-complete.json â”œâ”€â”€ E1-complete.json â””â”€â”€ ... ``` Execution can resume from any checkpoint after interruption. --- ## ğŸ¨ Frontend Quality System ORC includes an anti-slop system that **blocks generic AI output**. ### Anti-Slop Detection | Category | Blocked Patterns | |----------|-----------------| | **Layout** | Generic hero sections, uniform card grids, 4-column footers | | **Styling** | Default Tailwind colors (`blue-500`), `rounded-lg` everywhere | | **Interaction** | Opacity-only hovers, missing focus states | | **Animation** | `transition-all duration-300`, linear easing, no exit animations | ### Innovation Scoring Every frontend component receives an innovation score. **Below minimum = blocked.** | Component Type | Minimum Score | |----------------|---------------| | Landing Page | 7/10 | | Marketing Component | 8/10 | | Dashboard UI | 5/10 | | Forms | 4/10 | ### Design Research Phase For frontend stories, ORC automatically: 1. Spawns a **Design Researcher** agent 2. Analyzes world-class references (Linear, Vercel, Stripe, Remotion) 3. Documents techniques and anti-patterns 4. Guides implementation with research insights --- ## ğŸ§  Learning System ORC gets smarter with every execution. ### Pattern Types ```json { "success_patterns": [], // What works "anti_patterns": [], // What doesn't work "user_preferences": {}, // How you like things "project_knowledge": {}, // Project-specific info "technique_stats": {} // Success/failure rates } ``` ### Pattern Matching 1. Story description generates semantic embedding 2. Embeddings compared against learned patterns 3. Matches above 80% similarity attached as `suggested_approach` 4. Patterns ranked by confidence score ### Confidence Decay ``` confidence = base_confidence Ã— recency_factor Ã— success_factor ``` - Unused patterns decay over time - Anti-patterns never decay - High-success patterns maintain confidence --- ## ğŸ“ Project Structure ``` ORC/ â”œâ”€â”€ .claude-plugin/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ marketplace.json # Marketplace catalog â”œâ”€â”€ plugins/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ orc/ # ORC plugin â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ .claude-plugin/ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ plugin.json # Plugin manifest â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ skills/orc/SKILL.md # Skill definition â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ agents/ # Agent definitions (19 files) â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ commands/ # Command definitions (13 files) â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/hooks.json # Lifecycle hooks â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ contracts/ # JSON Schema definitions â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ patterns/ # Implementation patterns â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ frontend/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ api/ â”‚ â”‚ â”œâ”€â”€ auth/ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ database/ â”‚ â””â”€â”€ docs/ # Documentation â”‚ â””â”€â”€ master-config.json # Quality rules & thresholds ``` --- ## âš™ï¸ Configuration ### `master-config.json` ```json { "anti_slop_rules": { "enabled": true, "on_detection": { "action": "block_completion", "message": "Slop pattern detected. Research better approaches." } }, "innovation_minimums": { "landing_page": 7, "marketing_component": 8, "dashboard_ui": 5, "forms": 4 }, "design_review_gate": { "enabled": true, "max_revision_rounds": 2 } } ``` --- ## ğŸ“š Documentation | Document | Description | |----------|-------------| | [Architecture](plugins/orc/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md) | Deep dive into agent system | | [Commands](plugins/orc/docs/COMMANDS.md) | Complete command reference | | [Pattern Library](plugins/orc/docs/PATTERN-LIBRARY.md) | Available implementation patterns | | [Creating Specialists](plugins/orc/docs/CREATING-SPECIALISTS.md) | Guide to adding new agents | --- ## ğŸ¤ Contributing ### Adding Patterns ```bash # Create new pattern plugins/orc/patterns/{category}/{pattern-name}.md # Include: # - Reference sources # - All states (hover, focus, active, etc.) # - Code examples # - Anti-patterns to avoid ``` ### Adding Specialists ```bash # Create new specialist plugins/orc/agents/{specialist-name}.md # Required frontmatter: # --- # name: specialist-name # type: specialist # model: opus # tools: [Read, Write, ...] # spawned_by: [implementer] # --- ``` --- ## ğŸ“„ License MIT License â€” see [LICENSE](LICENSE) for details. ---
**Built for developers who ship.** *One prompt. Complete implementation.* [Report Bug](https://github.com/twofoldtech-dakota/ORC/issues) â€¢ [Request Feature](https://github.com/twofoldtech-dakota/ORC/issues) â€¢ [Discussions](https://github.com/twofoldtech-dakota/ORC/discussions)

plugins.name: orc
plugins.description: Autonomous multi-agent system that transforms goals into tested implementations through Epic/Feature/Story hierarchy with quality gates

marketplaces.name: studio-marketplace
marketplaces.description: STUDIO plugin marketplace - Autonomous workflow orchestration for Claude Code
marketplaces.repo_description: A high-performance orchestration layer built to give "Industrial Clarity" and engineering precision to AI-assisted development

files.README.md:
# STUDIO > **S**elf-**T**eaching **U**nified **D**evelopment & **I**ntelligent **O**rchestration **AI builds code. STUDIO makes sure it's correct.** ``` â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•— â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ ğŸ¯ GOAL ğŸ“‹ PLAN ğŸ”¨ BUILD âœ… VERIFIED â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ "Add user â”€â”€â”€â–¶ Atomic steps â”€â”€â”€â–¶ Execute & â”€â”€â”€â–¶ Quality â•‘ â•‘ auth" with validation validate gate passed â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• ``` --- ## Why STUDIO? | AI Problem | STUDIO Solution | |------------|-----------------| | ğŸ¤” Assumes requirements | Mandatory questioning with domain experts | | ğŸƒ Declares success early | Quality gates block incomplete work | | ğŸŒŠ Drifts from intent | Plan anchors every execution step | | ğŸ§  Forgets your preferences | Memory system persists rules across sessions | | ğŸ­ Inconsistent voice | Brand context embedded in every plan | | âŒ Silent failures | Classified errors with fix suggestions | | ğŸ˜° No recovery option | Git-based rollback to any task | --- ## Quick Start ### Installation ```bash # Install Claude Code npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code # Start Claude Code claude # Add STUDIO plugin /plugin marketplace add https://github.com/twofoldtech-dakota/studio.git /plugin install studio@studio-marketplace ``` ### Your First Build ```bash /build "Add user authentication with email verification" ``` STUDIO will: 1. **Ask clarifying questions** using domain expert personas 2. **Create an execution-ready plan** with atomic, validated steps 3. **Challenge the plan** for edge cases and risks 4. **Execute with validation** and automatic retry on failure 5. **Run quality gates** before marking complete ### Your First Brand Setup ```bash /brand ``` Complete a 5-phase guided interview to establish: - **Identity** â€” Mission, vision, values, personality - **Audience** â€” Who you serve, their pain points - **Voice** â€” How you sound, vocabulary, principles - **Positioning** â€” Market category, differentiation - **Messaging** â€” Value propositions, key messages --- ## Commands ### Build Commands | Command | Description | |---------|-------------| | `/build "goal"` | Start a new build | | `/build:preview "goal"` | Preview what would happen (dry-run) | | `/build:interactive "goal"` | Step-by-step with confirmation | | `/build resume` | Resume incomplete build | | `/build status` | Check current build | | `/build abort` | Cancel build | ### Brand & Content | Command | Description | |---------|-------------| | `/brand` | Start brand discovery | | `/brand:update [area]` | Update identity, voice, audience, or messaging | | `/brand:audit` | Check brand consistency | | `/blog "topic"` | Create brand-aligned blog post | | `/blog:outline "topic"` | Create outline only | | `/blog:ideas` | Generate topic ideas | ### Project Management | Command | Description | |---------|-------------| | `/project:init "name"` | Create multi-task project | | `/project:task "goal"` | Add task with dependencies | | `/project:status` | Show project status | | `/project:graph` | Display dependency graph | ### Utilities | Command | Description | |---------|-------------| | `/analytics` | View build metrics dashboard | | `/trace` | Show requirements traceability | | `/rollback:list` | List recovery points | | `/rollback:to ` | Rollback to pre-task state | --- ## The Three Agents ``` â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ ğŸ”µ THE PLANNER â”‚ ğŸŸ¡ THE BUILDER â”‚ ğŸŸ£ THE CONTENT WRITER â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ Creates plans â”‚ Executes plans â”‚ Creates content â”‚ â”‚ Embeds context â”‚ Validates steps â”‚ Applies brand voice â”‚ â”‚ Challenges self â”‚ Retries on fail â”‚ Optimizes for SEO â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` ### The Planner - Loads **playbooks** (methodologies for thinking) - Consults **team members** (domain expert personas) - Embeds **memory rules** (your preferences) - Runs **Five Challenges** (adversarial self-review) - Calculates **confidence score** before execution ### The Builder - Executes **exactly** what the plan specifies - Runs **validation commands** after each step - Applies **fix hints** and retries on failure - Triggers **quality gate** before completion - **Never improvises** â€” follows the plan ### The Content Writer - Loads **brand context** (identity, voice, audiences) - Applies **voice rules** consistently - Structures with **problem-first framework** - Optimizes for **SEO** and conversion - Verifies **brand alignment** --- ## Quality Assurance ### Confidence Scoring Every plan gets scored before execution: ``` â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•— â•‘ PLAN CONFIDENCE: 85% (MEDIUM) â•‘ â• â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•£ â•‘ Requirements: [â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–‘â–‘] 80% â•‘ â•‘ Step Quality: [â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ] 100% â•‘ â•‘ Context: [â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–‘â–‘] 80% â•‘ â•‘ Risk: [â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–‘â–‘] 80% â•‘ â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• ``` ### The Five Challenges Before any plan executes, it must answer: 1. **REQUIREMENTS** â€” Does this solve what was asked? 2. **EDGE CASES** â€” What inputs would break this? 3. **SIMPLICITY** â€” Is this the simplest solution? 4. **INTEGRATION** â€” Does this fit the codebase? 5. **FAILURE MODES** â€” What happens when it fails? ### Quality Gate Verdicts | Verdict | Meaning | |---------|---------| | **STRONG** | All checks passed | | **SOUND** | Required passed, optional warnings | | **BLOCKED** | Required check failed â€” fix required | --- ## Memory System STUDIO learns your preferences and remembers them: ``` studio/rules/ â”œâ”€â”€ global.md # Project-wide conventions â”œâ”€â”€ frontend.md # UI/UX preferences â”œâ”€â”€ backend.md # API/architecture patterns â”œâ”€â”€ testing.md # Testing requirements â”œâ”€â”€ security.md # Security constraints â””â”€â”€ devops.md # Infrastructure preferences ``` When you correct something, STUDIO asks: > "Should I remember this preference?" If yes, it writes the rule and applies it to all future builds. --- ## Project Structure ``` studio/ â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ¤– agents/ # Agent definitions (Planner, Builder, Content Writer) â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“‹ commands/ # Available commands (/build, /brand, /blog, etc.) â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“š playbooks/ # Methodologies (how agents think) â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ‘¥ team/ # Domain expert personas (13 specialists) â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ”— hooks/ # Lifecycle hooks (progress, errors, validation) â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“ schemas/ # Validation schemas â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ¨ brand/ # Brand source of truth â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ”§ scripts/ # Runtime scripts â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“Š data/ # Error patterns, analytics â”œâ”€â”€ ğŸ“ templates/ # Code templates â””â”€â”€ ğŸ“– docs/ # Documentation â”œâ”€â”€ STUDIO-GUIDE.md # Complete system guide â””â”€â”€ QUICK-REFERENCE.md # Quick lookup card ``` --- ## Architecture ``` STUDIO SYSTEM â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ USER â”‚â”€â”€â”€â”€â–¶â”‚ PLANNER â”‚â”€â”€â”€â”€â–¶â”‚ BUILDER â”‚â”€â”€â”€â”€â–¶â”‚ VERIFIEDâ”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ GOAL â”‚ â”‚ AGENT â”‚ â”‚ AGENT â”‚ â”‚ OUTPUT â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”¬â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”Œâ”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ MEMORY â”‚ â”‚ HOOKS â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ SYSTEM â”‚ â”‚ SYSTEM â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ (Learning)â”‚ â”‚ (Validation) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”˜ ``` --- ## Advanced Features ### Parallel Execution Steps without dependencies run simultaneously for faster builds. ### Project Orchestration Manage multiple related tasks with dependency graphs: ``` [Auth] â”€â”€â”€â”€â” â”œâ”€â”€â”€â–¶ [Cart] â”€â”€â”€â–¶ [Checkout] [Catalog] â”€â”˜ ``` ### Rollback System Git-based snapshots let you recover to any pre-task state: ```bash /rollback:list # See available points /rollback:to --force # Restore pre-task state ``` ### Analytics Dashboard Track build success rates, durations, and quality metrics: ```bash /analytics # View dashboard ``` ### Error Classification 20+ error patterns with contextual fix suggestions and auto-fix options. ### Interactive Mode Step-by-step execution with confirmation at each change: ```bash /build:interactive "goal" ``` --- ## Documentation | Document | Description | |----------|-------------| | [STUDIO-GUIDE.md](docs/STUDIO-GUIDE.md) | Complete system documentation with visuals | | [QUICK-REFERENCE.md](docs/QUICK-REFERENCE.md) | Quick lookup card for commands | | [IMPLEMENTATION-PLAN.md](IMPLEMENTATION-PLAN.md) | Feature implementation details | --- ## Stack | Component | Technology | |-----------|------------| | Runtime | Claude Code Plugin | | Agents | YAML definitions | | Validation | JSON Schema | | Hooks | Shell + LLM prompts | | Storage | File-based (JSON, YAML, Markdown) | --- ## Philosophy ``` â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•— â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ "Plan thoroughly, execute precisely, learn continuously" â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ â€¢ Every plan is CHALLENGED before execution â•‘ â•‘ â€¢ Every step has EXECUTABLE validation â•‘ â•‘ â€¢ Every preference is REMEMBERED for future use â•‘ â•‘ â€¢ Every requirement is TRACEABLE to implementation â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• ``` --- ## License MIT ---

Built with precision. Executed with confidence. Learned continuously.

plugins.name: studio
plugins.description: Autonomous workflow orchestration through three phases: Planning, Building, and Verifying
